H0.text: The name of which chemical element takes its name from the Greek for light-bringing. Phosphorus

H1.text: The name of which chemical element takes its name from the Greek for light-bringing. Helium

H2.text: The name of which chemical element takes its name from the Greek for light-bringing. Lucifer

H3.text: The name of which chemical element takes its name from the Greek for light-bringing. 32P

A4.text: The name phosphorus is a reference to the god of the Morning star in Greek mythology, inspired by the faint glow of white phosphorus when exposed to oxygen.

A5.text: The word phosphorus itself (Ancient Greek: Φωσφόρος, romanized: Phōsphoros, lit. 'light-bearer') originates from Greek mythology, where it references the god of the morning star, also known as the planet Venus.
